Note.Content: NRSV "fall into the Pit" REB "fall into a pit" = [1a]

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control
= causative process by which humans cause (other) humans and objects to move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control
meaning unsure; possibly: = action by which a swarm of insects moves forward heedless of whatever opposition comes their way
literally: (one's) heart falls; hence: = process by which humans lose courage
literally: (one's) face falls; hence: = process when humans become angry and show that with their facial expression
literally: to cause (one's) face to fall; hence: = action when deities show their anger by their facial expression
literally: to fall (on someone); hence: = process by which humans are held responsible for a certain action, whether in the past or in the future
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans are brought forth from the womb
literally: to drop; hence: = causative process by which humans bring forth children from the womb
literally: to fall into the hand(s) of someone; hence: = process by which humans or nations fall under someone else's authority and control
literally: to fall upon (one's) sword; hence: = action by which humans kill themselves with their own sword
literally: to fall; hence: = action by which humans leave the group to which they belong and join another group, which is often seen as the enemy
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans become suddenly involved in a certain difficult situation
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which certain activity comes to an end
literally: to let fall; hence: = action by which humans refrain from engaging in a certain activity
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which a set of past activities becomes invalid and will have to be repeated
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which someone's promises do not have become a reality
literally: to cause to fall; hence: = causative process by which deities cause their promises not to become a reality
literally: to fall upon; = action by which humans start a fight with other humans
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which a certain event starts happening
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which a situation develops in a certain way
literally: to fall (upon someone); hence: = process by which humans are affected by a certain condition, emotion, or supernatural influence
literally: to cause to fall (upon someone); hence: = causative process by which deities or certain attitudes cause humans to be affected by a certain condition or emotion
literally: to fall on (someone's) neck; hence: = action by which humans spontaneously embrace other humans
literally: to fall on (someone's) face; hence: = action by which humans spontaneously embrace other humans
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which a structure loses its inner strength and falls apart
literally: to cause to fall; hence: = causative process by which humans cause a structure to lose its inner strength and fall apart
exact meaning unsure; literally: (one's) thigh sags; hence: = process by which a woman becomes unable to bear children

Glosses.Gloss: to be unable to bear children

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: exact meaning unsure; literally: to cause (someone's) thigh to sag; hence: = causative process by which deities cause a woman to be unable to bear children

Glosses.Gloss: to make unable to bear children

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to fall (before someone); hence: = process by which information reaches someone in authority
literally: to cause to fall (before someone); hence: = causative process by humans cause information to reach someone in authority
literally: to fall (to someone); hence: = process by which land becomes someone's property
literally: to cause (something) to fall (to someone); hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause land to become someone else's property
literally: the lot falls (on someone); hence: = process by which individuals or groups are selected by throwing lots
literally: to let lots fall; hence: = causative action by which humans throw lots in order to select individuals or groups from among a large group
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which people lose some of their status
= process by which humans or animals lose their balance while walking or standing and end up flat on the ground; ≈ associated with failure and loss of face
= state in which humans lie flat on the ground, after having been killed or severely wounded by enemies
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans are killed or severely wounded by enemies
literally: to cause to fall; hence: = causative process or action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to be killed or severely wounded by enemies
= action by which humans assume a lying position, often in order to show respect, allegiance, or devotion
literally: to fall; hence: = action by which humans let themselves slide from the back of a riding animal
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to assume a lying position
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans die in a violent way
literally: to lie; hence: = state in which a group of people are temporarily residing in a certain place
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which an individual or nation loses power, prosperity or status
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which someone's arms lose their strength, ≈ which is a symbol for their political and military strength
literally: to fall on a bed; hence: = process by which humans become sick or wounded and are confined to their bed
exact meaning unknown; literally: to let fall; hence: = state in which humans are unappreciative of something
